required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Glycaemic and Insulinaemic Responses After Consumption of FOS.
clinical_study.official_title: Postprandial Glycaemic and Insulinaemic Responses After Consumption of Minicakes Containing FOS in Adults

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to evaluate the glycaemic and insulinaemic response of short-chain fructo-oligosaccharides (scFOS) used to replace sugars (e.g. dextrose) in foods.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose kinetics with 7 points. Analysis of the Area under the curve of glucose.

secondary_outcome.description: Blood insulin kinetics with 7 points. Analysis of the Area under the curve of insulin.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One-time data (the highest one) within the 2hrs 5mins kinetics.
secondary_outcome.description: Peak of blood glucose during kinetics.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: One-time data (the highest one) within the 2hrs 5mins kinetics.
secondary_outcome.description: Peak of blood insulin during kinetics.

secondary_outcome.measure: Glucose Tmax : time to reach the peak of blood glucose
Insulin Tmax : time to reach the peak of blood insulin

arm_group.description: Control group consuming sponge cakes containing in total 24g of dextrose.
Group consuming sponge cakes in which 30% of the dextrose was replaced by FOS.

intervention.description: 100g of sponge cakes made with 24g of dextrose.
100g of sponge cakes made with 19.4g of dextrose and 9.1g of FOS.
